data.name: Title
data.value: Sign up for Energy - Your order summary - SSE

data.name: VATDisclaimer
data.value: This price includes VAT at 5% and any applicable discounts.

data.name: WrongMeterDetailsLinkAlt
data.value: Link if your meter details are incorrect

data.name: CheckboxLegend
data.value: Do you agree to these terms and conditions and other product details above?

data.name: CreditCheckLinkSuffix
data.value: There may also be a requirement to take a security deposit.

data.name: CreditCheckParagraph
data.value: In order to process your application, we will supply your personal information to credit reference agencies (CRAs) and they will give us information about you – such as your financial history. We do this to assess creditworthiness and product suitability, check your identity, manage your account, trace and recover debts and prevent criminal activity. We will also continue to exchange information about you with CRAs on an ongoing basis, including about your settled accounts and any debts not fully repaid on time. CRAs will share your information with other organisations. The identities of the CRAs and the way in which they use and share personal information, are

data.name: DDCalculationParagraph
data.value: We work out your monthly payment by dividing your Personal Projection by 12 and rounding it up to the nearest pound. Your Direct Debit will be taken from your bank account on the date shown.

data.name: PaymentMethodParagraphDD
data.value: We may change your payment method if you have any outstanding charges on your gas and/or electricity account(s) and/or don’t comply with the terms and conditions relating to that payment method. We’ll write to you about the change at least seven to ten working days before the change begins, in accordance with our Licences. If we change your payment method from Direct Debit to quarterly billing, then you’ll no longer get the Direct Debit discount. This means you’ll pay the equivalent of £40 more per fuel, per year through your standing charge (calculated proportionately on a pence per day basis).

data.name: PaymentMethodParagraphNonDD
data.value: We may change your payment method if you have any outstanding charges on your gas and/or electricity account(s) and/or don’t comply with the terms and conditions relating to that payment method. We’ll write to you about the change at least seven to ten working days before the change begins, in accordance with our Licences.

data.name: TermsAndConditionsAriaDescription
data.value: Tick this box to confirm you agree to these terms and conditions and other product details above.

data.name: SidePanel1
data.value: Complete your order and we’ll switch your energy supply within 21 days

data.name: SidePanel2
data.value: We’ll send you a Welcome pack and when your switch is complete, send us your first meter reading

data.name: SidePanel3DD
data.value: We’ll be in touch when your new Direct Debit plan is set up and your old supplier will send you a final statement

data.name: SidePanelNonDD
data.value: Your old supplier will send you a final statement or bill

data.name: MeterDetailsModalMessage

data.name: ModalMeterDetailsMessage
data.value: We’ve used national metering databases to find the meter details for your address.

data.name: DDHeader_Energy
data.value: Direct Debit or standing order discount

data.name: PayAsYouGoText
data.value: If you’re a Pay As You Go customer with a debt of less than £500, it’s now even easier to switch. The Debt Assignment Protocol allows you to change supplier and take your debt with you. If your current energy supplier successfully objects to you moving supply because of your debt balance the Debt Assignment Protocol is activated, allowing the switch to continue. It isn’t guaranteed, but it could be an option if you want to switch. Find out more in our Debt Assignment Protocol article. We’ll need to exchange your account details and debt information with your current energy supplier. By continuing with the switch, you agree that we can share this information
